location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 15 of 1866 from Lewis Pelly, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Charles Gonne, Secretary to Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: Brief letter to Government, forwarding a letter from the local agent at Muskat [Muscat] regarding the small craft confiscated from the Jenebah [Janaba] tribe.The enclosed letter from Mr G Rozario, in charge of local duties, Muskat Political Agency, 6 March 1866 reports that the money made from the sale of the craft has been distributed amongst the Benyas [Banyas] who were plundered and enclosed a statement to show the amount each individual received.The Government's reply No. 822 of 1866 can be found on the verso of folio 68.
